about.name: The following questions are from real DMV written tests. These are some of the actual permit questions you will face in California. Each permit practice test question has three answer choices. Select one answer for each question and select "grade this section." You can find this button at the bottom of the drivers license quiz.  For a complete list of questions and answers for California please visit https://cheat-sheets.dmv-written-test.com/en/california/car.

hasPart.name: You are driving behind a motorcycle and want to pass. You must:

about.name: You are driving behind a motorcycle and want to pass. You must:

hasPart.assesses: You are driving behind a motorcycle and want to pass. You must: | You are driving behind a motorcycle and want to pass. You must: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: When passing a motorcycle, allow a full lane to the motorcycle. Never crowd into the same lane as the motorcycle. Returning to the original lane too soon can force a rider to swerve to the right and into traffic or off the road.

suggestedAnswer.text: Stay in the right lane as much as possible because the motorcycle is small and doesn't use all of the lane.

comment.text: Stay in the right lane as much as possible because the motorcycle is small and doesn't use all of the lane.

suggestedAnswer.text: Blow your horn to make the motorcycle move onto the shoulder so that you can pass.

comment.text: Blow your horn to make the motorcycle move onto the shoulder so that you can pass.

suggestedAnswer.text: Have your vehicle entirely in the left lane before and during the pass.

comment.text: Have your vehicle entirely in the left lane before and during the pass.

acceptedAnswer.text: Have your vehicle entirely in the left lane before and during the pass.

comment.text: Have your vehicle entirely in the left lane before and during the pass.

answerExplanation.text: When passing a motorcycle, allow a full lane to the motorcycle. Never crowd into the same lane as the motorcycle. Returning to the original lane too soon can force a rider to swerve to the right and into traffic or off the road.

comment.text: You are driving behind a motorcycle and want to pass. You must: | When passing a motorcycle, allow a full lane to the motorcycle. Never crowd into the same lane as the motorcycle. Returning to the original lane too soon can force a rider to swerve to the right and into traffic or off the road.

hasPart.name: You want to pass a bicyclist in a narrow traffic lane when an oncoming vehicle is approaching. You should:

about.name: You want to pass a bicyclist in a narrow traffic lane when an oncoming vehicle is approaching. You should:

hasPart.assesses: You want to pass a bicyclist in a narrow traffic lane when an oncoming vehicle is approaching. You should: | You want to pass a bicyclist in a narrow traffic lane when an oncoming vehicle is approaching. You should: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: In this situation, you should take on one danger at a time. Rather than trying to squeeze between the bicyclist and the other vehicle, you should slow down to let the other vehicle pass, and then pass the bicyclist when it is safe to do so.

suggestedAnswer.text: Honk your horn then pass the bicyclist.

comment.text: Honk your horn then pass the bicyclist.

suggestedAnswer.text: Slow down and let the vehicle pass you before you pass the bicyclist.

comment.text: Slow down and let the vehicle pass you before you pass the bicyclist.

suggestedAnswer.text: Wait until the bicyclist rides off the roadway.

comment.text: Wait until the bicyclist rides off the roadway.

acceptedAnswer.text: Slow down and let the vehicle pass you before you pass the bicyclist.

comment.text: Slow down and let the vehicle pass you before you pass the bicyclist.

answerExplanation.text: In this situation, you should take on one danger at a time. Rather than trying to squeeze between the bicyclist and the other vehicle, you should slow down to let the other vehicle pass, and then pass the bicyclist when it is safe to do so.

comment.text: You want to pass a bicyclist in a narrow traffic lane when an oncoming vehicle is approaching. You should: | In this situation, you should take on one danger at a time. Rather than trying to squeeze between the bicyclist and the other vehicle, you should slow down to let the other vehicle pass, and then pass the bicyclist when it is safe to do so.

hasPart.name: California's "Basic Speed Law" says:
hasPart.assesses: California's "Basic Speed Law" says: | California's "Basic Speed Law" says: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: The "Basic Speed Law" means that you may never drive faster than would be safe in current conditions. For example, if you drive 45 mph in a 55 mph zone during a dense fog, even though you are below the posted limit, you may be cited for driving too fast for conditions.

suggestedAnswer.text: You should never drive faster than posted speed limits.

comment.text: You should never drive faster than posted speed limits.

suggestedAnswer.text: You should never drive faster than is safe for current conditions.

comment.text: You should never drive faster than is safe for current conditions.

suggestedAnswer.text: The maximum speed limit in California is 70 mph on certain freeways.

comment.text: The maximum speed limit in California is 70 mph on certain freeways.

acceptedAnswer.text: You should never drive faster than is safe for current conditions.

comment.text: You should never drive faster than is safe for current conditions.

answerExplanation.text: The "Basic Speed Law" means that you may never drive faster than would be safe in current conditions. For example, if you drive 45 mph in a 55 mph zone during a dense fog, even though you are below the posted limit, you may be cited for driving too fast for conditions.

comment.text: California's "Basic Speed Law" says: | The "Basic Speed Law" means that you may never drive faster than would be safe in current conditions. For example, if you drive 45 mph in a 55 mph zone during a dense fog, even though you are below the posted limit, you may be cited for driving too fast for conditions.

hasPart.name: If you pass a school bus that is stopped with its red lights flashing, you will:

about.name: If you pass a school bus that is stopped with its red lights flashing, you will:

hasPart.assesses: If you pass a school bus that is stopped with its red lights flashing, you will: | If you pass a school bus that is stopped with its red lights flashing, you will: - Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Drivers must come to a complete stop when approaching a school bus stopped with its red lights flashing. Failure to stop until the red lights stop flashing may result in license suspension and a fine of up to $1,000.

comment.text: Be fined up to $1,000.
Be fined up to $100.
Face no legal consequences.
Be fined up to $1,000.

answerExplanation.text: Drivers must come to a complete stop when approaching a school bus stopped with its red lights flashing. Failure to stop until the red lights stop flashing may result in license suspension and a fine of up to $1,000.

comment.text: If you pass a school bus that is stopped with its red lights flashing, you will: | Drivers must come to a complete stop when approaching a school bus stopped with its red lights flashing. hasPart.name: If you are getting tired while driving, you should:

about.name: If you are getting tired while driving, you should:

hasPart.assesses: If you are getting tired while driving, you should: | If you are getting tired while driving, you should: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: To avoid the dangers of fatigued driving, take breaks every hour or so during a long trip. If possible, share driving responsibilities with another person so you can each sleep while the other person drives.

suggestedAnswer.text: Stop and either get rest or change drivers.

comment.text: Stop and either get rest or change drivers.
Drink something with caffeine.
Open a window.

acceptedAnswer.text: Stop and either get rest or change drivers.

comment.text: Stop and either get rest or change drivers.

answerExplanation.text: To avoid the dangers of fatigued driving, take breaks every hour or so during a long trip. If possible, share driving responsibilities with another person so you can each sleep while the other person drives.

comment.text: If you are getting tired while driving, you should: | To avoid the dangers of fatigued driving, take breaks every hour or so during a long trip. If possible, share driving responsibilities with another person so you can each sleep while the other person drives.
